p.s: In the following, I'm going to discuss Shakespeare's relevance for young people today.
Especially Young people often don't feel like Shakespeare because it is very difficult to understand.
Shakespeare used very old English with younger people don't even know.
He also founded a lotslot of phrases.
Today they aren't that common anymore so young people don't get them.
In addition are there other good writers which are easier to understand.
This could solve the problem that young people fastly looselose their motivation, when they deal with Shakespeare.
If they don't get why Shakespeare is so special there is no reason, why they have to deal with him.
On the other hand there are a lot good aspects why dealing with Shakespeare is something good for young children.
First Shakespeare is a very important historical person.
If you read his plays and poems you learn beside literature also some thing about history.
He had also such a big impact on englishEnglish and change the language a lot.
So it is important to know why the language today is like this.
Even if the phrases he invented orange juice that awesome they still exist and if you know them you could use them.
This could help one to express for example feelings better.
Another argument is that his topics are timeless and so today still relevant.
Especially a topic like love will always be important.
Furthermore lots of films and storysstories are based on Shakespeare.
This shows how important and great his story line is.
Dealing with Shakespeare could also inspire young people.
Maybe they start to write poems or plays or get creative in another way.
Young people also learn how to deal with stylistic devices.
If someone tries to convince them for example by using them in a political speech, they know how to recognize and deal with them.
I think that this are a lot good arguments for dealing with Shakespeare.
But one should not forget how difficult his language is.
So I think if you deal for example with Shakespeare in school the teacher should make the lessons interesting and clear.
So the students get the topics and hopefully don't looselose their motivation.
To sum that up I think it is important to deal with Shakespeare.
His topics are still relevant and you can use your knowledge about stylistic devices also at another times.
But I think it is important that dealing with Shakespeare is interesting and clear so the young people don't looselose their motivation.
